Metadata: Restoration: A Newsletter about Salmon, Watersheds, and People (Issue No. 29, 30, and 31, April, August, and October 2002)
Oregon State University Sea Grant College Program
Only three newsletter issues in one entry published for 2002.

Through Restoration Newsletter, we want to help coastal residents obtain objective information so they can rise above the turmoil of the day's headlines and make well-informed choices for themselves, their communities, and their future. The following article titles are in these issues: APRIL issue: Governor Kitzhaber sounds alarm for the Williamette; Bush administration drops salmon habitat protections, by P. Hoobyar; Who pays for conservation on rurallands? by John Baur; Salmon-friendly power gets boost from regional group; Delisting a species from the Endangered Species Act: how important is habitat?; AUGUST issue: Restoring water quality in the Williamette-one more time, by Steve Greenwood; Conservation of wild salmon-why is it important? Federal court affirms oversight of timber and agricultural runoff, by P. Hoobyar; OCTOBER issue: Future growth patterns in the Williamette: A landscape perspective, by P. Hoobyar; Salmon-friendly wineries harvest more than grapes, by John Baur; A river of restoration opportunity, by Travis Williams; Science panel amasses data about agricultural impacts;
